description: The story revolves around Kaiman, who does not remember who he was before he was transfigured by a Magic user. This transformation left him with a reptile's head, and a desire to find out the truth about who he really is. Accompanied by Nikaido, his female companion, he tracks down Magic Users in "The Hole" and unceremoniously chomps down on their head, hoping to find out who it was that put him in this state. One by one, they witness this "second man" inside the head of Kaiman, and after pulling them back out of his mouth he asks them all a question... "What did the guy inside my head say?"
synonyms: สาปพันธุ์อสูร

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chidarumakun) Attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music. Long-time Hanshin Tigers fan. Did boss character design for the game Shadows of the Damned. Note: the current picture is indeed the mangaka herself, it was taken from the Dorohedoro anime livestream interview.

He started his career at Studio Live working on outsourced episodes for a few years. His first major role was as mechanical designer on the short series [The Cosmopolitan Prayers](https://anilist.co/anime/112/).

After leaving Studio Live he was involved in several [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) and [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) projects, with the former studio housing his debut as director on the short TOYOTA commercial series [PES: Peace Eco Smiles](https://anilist.co/anime/13427/).

He's been affiliated with Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) since 2014 where he helmed his first TV Series, [Garo: The Animation](https://anilist.co/anime/20753/), and several other anime.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Persona 5: Royal (Video Game, 2019) (OP Director, OP Storyboard, OP Key Animation)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1025616676341968896)

Shinji Kimura is a renown art director. He has also ventured into directing.
Previously affiliated with [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/). Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

**Akito Takahashi** is a publicity producer working for Toho.

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)
Masaya Saitou is a producer and publicity manager.
